segments.text: I notice the woman drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in water, and she doesn’t even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy stretching so high to grab those cookies, and I’m worried he’ll fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is shaking, and I can’t believe the girl isn’t helping him steady it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is so focused on her task that she’s completely ignoring the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl reaching out her hand, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s like no one cares about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy’s plate is already full of cookies, and he’s still grabbing more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and the cabinets are getting soaked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is acting in this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR
